description: Benchmark dataset containing edge case documents for testing engine robustness. Includes empty documents, special characters, unicode, very long text, malformed content, and boundary conditions.

documents.extracted_text:
WITNESS STATEMENT - INTERNATIONAL DOCUMENT

French: Je confirme que j'ai vu M. Dupont a 14h30. C'etait tres clair.

German: Ich bestatige, dass Herr Muller um 15:00 Uhr anwesend war.

Spanish: Confirmo que vi al Sr. Garcia a las 16:00. Era muy claro.

Chinese: 

Japanese: 

Arabic: 

Russian: 

Greek: 

Hebrew: 

Korean: 

Thai: 

Polish: Potwierdzam, ze widzialem pana Kowalskiego o godzinie 17:00.

Czech: Potvrzuji, ze jsem videl pana Novaka v 18:00.

Hungarian: Megerositem, hogy lattam Kovacs urat 19:00-kor.

Mixed: The defendant Mr. O'Brien-Mueller said "I didn't do it!" at cafe resume.

Signed: Jean-Pierre O'Connor-Yamamoto
Date: January 15, 2024

DOCUMENT WITH SPECIAL CHARACTERS

Mathematical symbols: + - * / = < > <= >= != % ^ & | ~ \ @ # $ 

Currency: $100.00 100.00 EUR 100.00 GBP 100.00 JPY 100

Punctuation: Hello! How are you? I'm fine, thanks... (well, mostly).

Quotes: He said "Hello" and she replied 'Hi there'

Brackets: [square] {curly} (round) <angle>

Slashes: forward/slash back\slash

Dashes: hyphen-ated em-dash en-dash

Ampersand: Smith & Jones, AT&T, R&D

Percent: 50% increase, 100% complete

Asterisks: *important* **very important** ***critical***

Underscores: file_name variable_name

Carets and tildes: 2^10 = 1024, ~approximately

Pipes: option1 | option2 | option3

Backticks: `code` ``more code``

HTML entities: & < >  

Line breaks:
New line here.

Tabs:	Tabbed	content	here.

COMPREHENSIVE POLICE INVESTIGATION REPORT

This document contains an extensive investigation report with multiple sections, appendices, and detailed analysis. The purpose is to test the engines' ability to handle large volumes of text.

SECTION 1: EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
This investigation was conducted over a period of six months. The investigation involved interviews with over 50 witnesses, review of thousands of documents, and analysis of digital evidence. The findings are summarized in this comprehensive report.

SECTION 2: BACKGROUND
The incident occurred on January 1, 2024. Initial reports were received at 10:00 AM. Officers were dispatched immediately. Upon arrival, the scene was secured and evidence collection began. The primary witness, Mr. John Smith, provided an initial statement. His account was consistent with the physical evidence found at the scene.

SECTION 3: WITNESS STATEMENTS
Witness 1 (John Smith): "I was walking down High Street when I observed the incident. The time was approximately 10:00 AM. I immediately called emergency services."

Witness 2 (Jane Doe): "I was in my car stopped at the traffic lights. I saw everything clearly. My account is consistent with Mr. Smith's statement."

Witness 3 (Robert Johnson): "I was inside the nearby shop but came outside when I heard the commotion. I can confirm the timeline provided by other witnesses."

Witness 4 (Sarah Williams): "I work at the cafe across the street. I had a clear view of the incident. Everything happened exactly as the other witnesses described."

Witness 5 (Michael Brown): "I was jogging in the area. I stopped when I saw the incident. My observations match those of the other witnesses."

SECTION 4: PHYSICAL EVIDENCE
Evidence Item 1: Photographs of the scene (100 images)
Evidence Item 2: CCTV footage (4 hours)
Evidence Item 3: Forensic samples (25 items)
Evidence Item 4: Witness contact information
Evidence Item 5: Vehicle registration data

SECTION 5: DIGITAL EVIDENCE
Phone records were obtained showing communications between relevant parties. Email correspondence was reviewed. Social media activity was analyzed. GPS data from mobile devices was extracted and analyzed.

SECTION 6: TIMELINE OF EVENTS
09:00 - Normal morning activity observed
09:30 - First suspicious activity noted
10:00 - Incident occurs
10:02 - Emergency services called
10:15 - First responders arrive
10:30 - Scene secured
11:00 - Evidence collection begins
12:00 - Initial witness statements taken

SECTION 7: ANALYSIS
Based on all evidence collected, the timeline of events is consistent across all witness accounts. The physical evidence supports the witness statements. Digital evidence corroborates the timeline.

SECTION 8: CONCLUSIONS
The investigation has been thorough and comprehensive. All evidence has been properly collected and analyzed. The findings support a clear understanding of the events that occurred.

APPENDIX A: FULL WITNESS STATEMENTS (1000+ pages)
APPENDIX B: EVIDENCE PHOTOGRAPHS (100 images)
APPENDIX C: FORENSIC REPORTS (50 pages)
APPENDIX D: DIGITAL EVIDENCE ANALYSIS (200 pages)
APPENDIX E: EXPERT OPINIONS (75 pages)

[This section would normally contain thousands of additional lines of detailed content, formatted documentation, evidence descriptions, and procedural records. For benchmark testing purposes, this represents a document that exceeds typical processing limits.]

END OF REPORT

Prepared by: Detective Inspector Sarah Anderson
Date: February 1, 2024
Case Reference: MET/2024/LONGDOC/001

STATEMENT REGARDING DATE FORMATS

The incident occurred on:
- 15 January 2024 (UK format)
- January 15, 2024 (US format)
- 2024-01-15 (ISO format)
- 15/01/2024 (DD/MM/YYYY)
- 01/15/2024 (MM/DD/YYYY)
- 15.01.2024 (European format)
- 15-Jan-2024 (Abbreviated)
- 15th January 2024 (Ordinal)
- Fifteenth of January, 2024 (Written)

All refer to the same date.

Time formats observed:
- 14:30 (24-hour)
- 2:30 PM (12-hour)
- 1430 hours (Military)
- Half past two in the afternoon (Written)
- 14:30:00 (With seconds)
- 14:30:00.000 (With milliseconds)
- 2024-01-15T14:30:00Z (ISO 8601)
- 2024-01-15T14:30:00+00:00 (With timezone)

Signed: Date Format Test Witness
Date: 15/01/2024

STANDARD FORM

I confirm that the above is true. I confirm that the above is true. I confirm that the above is true.

I understand the implications. I understand the implications. I understand the implications.

I agree to the terms. I agree to the terms. I agree to the terms.

Signature: _____________ Signature: _____________ Signature: _____________

Date: _____________ Date: _____________ Date: _____________

Witness: _____________ Witness: _____________ Witness: _____________

[This pattern repeats multiple times as is common in multi-copy carbon forms]

Copy 1 - Applicant
Copy 2 - Authority
Copy 3 - Records

I confirm that the above is true. I understand the implications. I agree to the terms.

WITNESS STATEMENT

witness statement

Witness Statement

WITNESS statement

witneSS StAteMenT

WiTnEsS sTaTeMeNt

The witness stated: THE EVENT OCCURRED at 3pm. The event occurred at 3PM. THE EVENT occurred at 3Pm.

Names: JOHN SMITH, john smith, John Smith, jOHN sMITH

Places: LONDON, london, London, LoNdOn

Dates: JANUARY 15, january 15, January 15, JaNuArY 15

This tests case-insensitive matching and normalization.

IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUSTICE
QUEEN'S BENCH DIVISION

BETWEEN:
                    THE CLAIMANT
                    - and -
                    THE DEFENDANT

JUDGMENT

INTER ALIA, the Court finds that the Defendant's actions constituted a prima facie breach of contract. The doctrine of res judicata does not apply as this matter has not been previously adjudicated.

Pursuant to CPR Part 24, the Claimant's application for summary judgment is GRANTED.

The Defendant is ORDERED to pay damages in quantum meruit, said damages to be assessed if not agreed.

Costs to follow the event, to be assessed on the standard basis if not agreed.

Liberty to apply.

Permission to appeal REFUSED. The Defendant may seek permission from the Court of Appeal pursuant to CPR 52.3.

This Order shall take effect ab initio from the date hereof.

Dated this 5th day of February 2024

[SEAL OF THE COURT]

Nota bene: This judgment is subject to the usual caveats regarding enforcement.

ground_truth.description: Expected engine behavior for edge case documents

expected_behavior.notes: Engine should handle empty text without crashing, return empty or null results
Engine should treat whitespace-only as effectively empty
Engine should handle null extracted_text field without crashing
Engine should process unicode characters correctly, no garbled output
Engine should not break on special characters, escape properly
Engine should handle large documents, may need chunking strategy
Minimal content should not cause errors, may return no findings
Numeric data should be processable, temporal/quantitative analysis possible
Various date formats should be normalized for comparison
Repeated content should not cause false positive contradictions
Case variations should be recognized as same content
Legal terminology should be processed, Latin phrases recognized
Redacted content markers should be recognized, not treated as contradictions
Common OCR errors should not prevent entity/content recognition
Tabular data should be extractable and analyzable

metadata.notes: All edge cases should be handled gracefully without engine crashes
